node.title: 'I think I'm done': How Adam Gilchrist's famous Perth century renewed his love of the game
node.alt: Few innings have been as memorable as Adam Gilchrist's final Test century from 15 years ago.
node.description: It has gone down as one of the greatest innings in Ashes history, but Adam Gilchrist has revealed just how close he was to pulling the pin on his career before his famous Perth ton in 2006.
node.content:
["Wearing shorts and sandals, Adam Gilchrist stands metres from the player's gate at the east end of the WACA Ground,\u00a0where he walked out to bat for Australia on the 16th of December in\u00a02006.\u00a0", "A day the Bureau of Meteorology has\u00a0listed as the hottest of that month, reaching a maximum of 38.8 degrees Celsius, a temperature Gilchrist recalls being \"extremely hot\".", "That day has since gone down in cricket legend\u00a0\u2014 it was the day Adam Gilchrist smashed 100 runs from 57 balls.", "", "
Adam Gilchrist stands on the WACA Ground, November, 2021(Glyn Jones)
", "\"Gilly had been actually going through a bit of a rough patch, and he was even doubting whether he wanted to continue playing for Australia,\" former teammate and friend Michael Hussey recalled.", "\"I travelled with him to the ground earlier in the Test match and I think he got a duck or not many runs in the first innings, and he was sort of saying, you know, 'I think I'm done.'", "", "
Gilchrist and Mike Hussey on the first day at the WACA Ground in 2006.(Getty: Andrew Romano)
", "Gilchrist had been on a relatively lean trot with the bat, making 270 runs in his previous 12 Test innings, including three ducks and just three scores of more than 12.", "\"I was personally almost resigned\u00a0that I was going to retire at the end of that series after a failure in the first innings, and the game had me a little bit by the scruff of the neck,\" Gilchrist said.", "\"I wasn't in that positive [a frame] of mind coming into that day.\"", "", "
Gilchirst fell to Monty Panesar for a duck in the first innings, before blasting 100 off 57 deliveries two days later.(AAP Image/Dean Lewins)
", "The wicketkeeper-batter had made a four-ball duck in the first innings, falling to Monty Panesar, who claimed five wickets on a WACA pitch not renowned for spin.", "But what unfolded on day three of the third Test has gone down in history.", "\"Everyone seems to be able to remember where they were,\" Gilchrist said.", "\"It's amazing. The crowd numbers \u2014 I don't know how big it was \u2014 but that seems to have swollen a bit over time.\"", "
Getting the thumbs up
", "Australia had England on the ropes, after claiming an unexpected win in Adelaide which gave the hosts a 2-0 lead in the five-match series.", "The home side took a 19-run advantage from the first innings, and set about crushing the spirit of the tourists, thanks firstly to a grinding century from Hussey.", "", "
Michael Hussey remembers it being a hot, difficult day to bat, on his way to a century.(AAP Image/Dean Lewins)
", "\"'England, their backs were against the wall in that series, they had to try and put in a massive performance on that day to stay alive in the series,\" Hussey said.", "\"So they came hard, and their bowlers really put in, as I said, it was really hot.", "\"When I got out, I was just absolutely exhausted and obviously hopeful that the next man in, Gilly, was going to go alright.\"", "", "
Gilchrist started his innings with a streaky edge off Andrew Flintoff through the gully for four.(Getty Images/Paul Kane)
", "BBC commentator Jonathan Agnew has called Ashes Test matches for 30 years, and remembers Gilchrist's nervy start.", "\"The way he got off the mark against Flintoff, his nemesis, bowling fast, round the wicket. He was just a few feet away from giving\u00a0a catch to gully and bagging a pair,\" Agnew recalled.", "\"And then goodness knows what might have happened.\"", "For Gilchrist, almost going out but managing to survive was a shift away from the norm.", "\"It felt like always in that little battle over that couple of years, those half chances were being taken by the English,\" Gilchrist said.", "\"I reckon if it wasn't the next ball, but pretty soon after that, there was a very similar delivery where I just stood up \u2014 and it sounds a bit self-indulgent \u2014 but I absolutely nailed this one off the back foot, right where I wanted it to go, right out of the middle. And I thought that's right. That's what it feels like.", "\"That, coupled with having been dismissed by Monty Panesar in the first innings for a duck playing a really tentative, negative stroke, I remember thinking if I face him again, I'm at least going to try and take him on.", "\"And if I get out, going hard at him, so be it.\"", "", "
Gilchrist's career was always about being fearless.(AAP Image/Dean Lewins)
", "Gilchrist and Michael Clarke, who had posted a century after the tea break, settled in as England's bowlers struggled in the heat.", "\"We sent a message back to Ricky Ponting about, 'Maybe we should go after England. We're in a commanding position,'\" Gilchrist said.", "\"We felt they were tired and if we went flat out for an hour, we might be a chance to declare and bowl to them.", "\"So the message went back and we just said don't worry about running out the 12th man, just give us a thumbs up or thumbs down and we'd know what you meant.", "", "
Gilchrist and\u00a0Michael Clarke \"going for it\"\u00a0during day three of the third Ashes Test in 2006.(Getty: Cameron Spencer)
", "What resulted was the second-fastest century in Test cricket history to that point, and one of the most dominant innings produced in an Ashes Test match.", "Gilchrist smashed 16 fours and four sixes, including 24 off one Panesar over, on\u00a0his way to an\u00a0unbeaten 102.", "\"That second 50\u00a0particularly, it was like some sort of\u00a0T20 innings,\" Agnew said.", "\"But he played a couple of beautiful drives, wonderful shots. I mean it was a proper innings.", "\"But when Gilchrist was playing properly, he did tend to score very quickly.", "", "
Gilchrist celebrating with the crowd at the WACA Ground after earning his record-breaking century.(AAP Image/Dean Lewins)
", "The English bowlers' torment was eventually ended when Ricky Ponting declared with 527 runs on the board.", "\"We declared, came off and Ricky had said 'No, just play it out 'til stumps,'\" Gilchrist said.", "\"And then a big smile broke out on his face and we had a chuckle about it.\"", "", "
Gilchrist and Clarke mistaking Ponting's call to not go for it may just be one of their greatest errors.(Getty Images/Hamish Blair)
", "
The less you know the better
", "While many cricket fans saw the explosiveness and raw talent Gilchrist had become known for, Hussey saw something deeper.\u00a0", "\"My emotions at the start were nervous for him, because I knew what he's going through mentally and not in a great place,\" Hussey said.", "\"And then it's like sheer joy because you see what he's actually doing out there.", "\"And then as he was getting closer to the 100 the sort of nerves come back a bit, because we knew\u00a0in the dressing room, that he was getting close to the world record.", "\"We're having these discussions in the rooms about what do we do? Like, do we get a message out to him? Or do we not say anything?\"", "In the end, Ponting decided not to tell Gilchrist he was on track to break West Indian great Viv Richards's record of 100 off 56 deliveries.", "", "
West Indies great Viv Richards recorded the fastest Test century in 1986.(Evening Standard/Hulton Archive/Getty Images)
", "\"I think he (Gilchrist) really had no idea what the record was. We're counting down the balls, and every one sailing over the fence, we're cheering,\" Hussey said.", "\"Every dot-ball we're like, no. We wanted him to get it so badly.\"", "It seems like the only person inside the WACA that day that didn't know the record was under threat was the man close to breaking it.", "\"I had no idea about the record,\" Gilchrist said.", "\"Before I went out to bat if you'd said to me, 'Who holds the fastest Test match century?'\u00a0I would probably have guessed Viv Richards.", "\"I don't think they had it up on the big scoreboard up there.", "\"If I started thinking about that and chasing something I might not have even got close. So I'm glad I wasn't aware of it.\"", "The record was within reach, but on his 55th delivery, Matthew Hoggard bowled wide outside off stump.", "\"I wasn't aware that the ball that Matthew Hoggard bowled when I could possibly have broken the record was so wide, and may have been called a wide on another day,\" Gilchrist said.", "\"But that doesn't bother me at all. At the time I was pretty happy just to get that result.\"", "
A cricket great leaves his mark
", "England coach Duncan Fletcher summed up the day in one sentence:\u00a0\"He can take the game away from you in an hour, and he had two good hours there.\"", "It was two good hours that delivered Gilchrist his final Test century and reminded him of his love for the game. It also extended his career by 13 months and eight Tests.", "", "
Adam Gilchrist blasted the second-fastest Test century to date, hitting 100 off just 57 balls(Getty Images/Cameron Spencer)
", "\"After that 100, it just reminded me of what cricket and batting and playing in a team sport was all about,\" Gilchrist said.", "\"I'd lost sight of that a little bit.", "\"It is hard sometimes to recognise what started you in that sport.", "\"Coming off and having that 100 and in feeling that feeling again, I remember thinking don't make any bold statements either way, just let it settle a bit.", "\"I quickly realised I still had, as my wife pointed out and then teammates, like I had a little bit more to offer.\"", "", "
Michael Clarke embracing\u00a0Adam Gilchrist\u00a0after he reached his ton.(Getty: Ezra Shaw)
", "Hussey watched the innings from the Players' Pavilion, and can't remember a definitive shift in Gilchrist's demeanour as he walked off.", "\"One of the great things about Gilly, and the great leaders that I've played with, is whether they're going really well or they're going really poorly, you quite often can't even tell,\" he said.", "", "
Michael Hussey sits in the Lillee Marsh stand at the WACA Ground, November 2021(ABC/Glyn Jones)
", "\"I remember Gilly coming in and just being like, 'Oh, yeah,\u00a0that was good, that was good fun.'", "\"And I'm thinking Gilly, I'd be like dancing around waving the bat, but he's not that sort of guy, he doesn't get carried away too much.\"", "For Gilchrist, producing that innings at the WACA Ground carries extra significance.", "\"I had a tough, tough start here from the crowd. I got belted \u2014 not that day, but at the start of my career \u2014 and I had to earn their respect,\" he said.", "", "
Australia's victory in the third Test match\u00a0resulted in them regaining the Ashes.\u00a0(Getty: Paul Kane)
", "\"To have the most often discussed\u00a0innings played out here at such a famous iconic ground is really, really special.\"", "For Agnew, watching on from the commentary box, it was an innings which underlined Gilchrist's influence on Test cricket.", "\"I'd liked him to have [broken the record], to have been there and to have witnessed it,\" Agnew said.", "\"It would have been very special.", "\"He needed some runs, and he needed to get his mind back to the destructive, trendsetting wicketkeeper-batsman that he was.", "\"He changed the role of that slot, that wicketkeeper-batsman.\u00a0He's changed it forever, and it was a reminder of how he had changed it.\""]
